name: The Life Cycle in Medieval and Early Modern Europe
description: This course examines the daily lives of medieval and early modern Europeans as they moved through birth, infancy, childhood, adolescence, marriage, adulthood, old age and death. Special attention is given to the ways in which gender, social status and local custom shaped thoughts and experiences throughout the life cycle. [24S]
prerequisites: HIS101H5, 0.5 credit medieval or early modern Europe.
